intro: Aiouea chapadaensis, commonly known as the Chapada ebony, is a small evergreen tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its dark, glossy leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
